version_description:
Logging can feel cucumbersome, but our cool new features are here to help.

*New macronutrients header! [Premium only] To check out your new custom views, tap or swipe the header to select the nutrient being displayed on your log screen (e.g. see your food's protein content instead of calorie content). This will help you easily track how you're doing against your custom nutrient goals.
* New date label by foods. When logging food, you'll see a date next to a food to indicate the last time you logged it.
* Added verified icon and note to the serving screen. To give you a better sense of which foods have been verified by the Lose It! team, we're showing you new text on the serving size screen.

We hope these changes lettuce all log faster. Happy tracking, Lose It! fam!

These two changes are actually super exciting. Eeeeeee!

* New! You'll notice we've introduced a "Health" section on your log. In this section, you can easily track and view current weight. With a Premium membership, this section will also show your water tracking goal.
* Also new! When adding food items, you can now quickly add the items to your log by swiping right. Because food is bae.

Tip: If you want to quickly add several items from a specific restaurant, search for the restaurant and swipe right on a few items.

Happy tracking, Lose It! fam.

This will help you easily track how you're doing against your custom nutrient goals.
* New date label by foods. When logging food, you'll see a date next to a food to indicate the last time you logged it.
* Added verified icon and note to the serving screen. To give you a better sense of which foods have been verified by the Lose It! team, we're showing you new text on the serving size screen.

We hope these changes lettuce all log faster. Happy tracking, Lose It! fam!

This will help you easily track how you're doing against your custom nutrient goals.

We hope these changes lettuce all log faster. Happy tracking, Lose It! fam!

It's that time again.. new fixes! Let's taco 'bout it.

* When you quick add calories to a snack, we now make sure it goes to the correct snack meal
* Started showing the decimal keyboard for the various calories/nutrients in the quick add calories screen
* Added an item's brand to its serving size screen
* Fixed a rare crash when refreshing the log
* Added negative sign before exercise calories in the log header
* Fixed a bug where you couldn’t tap the exercise icon in the duration screen and set it to pending

Woohoo! Now that all this is fixed, it's nacho problem anymore. Happy tracking!

It's that time again.. new fixes! Let's taco 'bout it.

* When you quick add calories to a snack, we now make sure it goes to the correct snack meal
* Started showing the decimal keyboard for the various calories/nutrients in the quick add calories screen
* Added an item's brand to its serving size screen
* Fixed a rare crash when refreshing the log
* Added negative sign before exercise calories in the log header
* Fixed a bug where you couldn’t tap the exercise icon in the duration screen and set it to pending

Woohoo! Now that all this is fixed, it's nacho problem anymore. Happy tracking!

andrea [1:45 PM]
Some nice fixes and fun updates, 'cause we think you're dino-mite.

Here's what's simply rawr-some in this release:
* GET EXCITED: we added a tab in exercise logging so you can log recent workouts! When adding exercise, tap the "Routines" tab to re-log something you've done before.
* Added support for Face ID in the passcode lock view
* Updated to show correct units when selecting your weight loss plan
* Added custom goals into the manual email report
* Fixed Snap It layout on the iPhone X (Tap the camera icon on your log to try it out)
* Slipped in some little improvements to food search
* Fixed an issue that would freeze text entry in basic and custom goals
* Fixed net carb calculation on the log when a food doesn’t have any fiber value set
* Fixed issue that would prevent the app from being terminated if Touch I was enabled for passcode lock
* Fix an issue where creating a new food after scanning a barcode wouldn’t save to the log

May not be mammoth changes, but we hope they help. Happy tracking, Lose It! fam!

Some nice fixes and fun updates, 'cause we think you're dino-mite.

Here's what's simply rawr-some in this release:
* GET EXCITED: we added a tab in exercise logging so you can log recent workouts! When adding exercise, tap the "Routines" tab to re-log something you've done before.
* Added support for Face ID in the passcode lock view
* Updated to show correct units when selecting your weight loss plan
* Added custom goals into the manual email report
* Fixed Snap It layout on the iPhone X (Tap the camera icon on your log to try it out)
* Slipped in some little improvements to food search
* Fixed an issue that would freeze text entry in basic and custom goals
* Fixed net carb calculation on the log when a food doesn’t have any fiber value set
* Fixed issue that would prevent the app from being terminated if Touch I was enabled for passcode lock
* Fix an issue where creating a new food after scanning a barcode wouldn’t save to the log

May not be mammoth changes, but we hope they help. Happy tracking, Lose It! fam!

S..S..Spring? Is that you? In celebration of all things warm and wonderful, here's a fresh list of updates.

* We solved the decimal dilemma! Now you can save decimal digits if you use the comma as a separator.
* Made sure the log view is updated after logging an exercise routine on the iPad
* Fixed the food serving picker layout on the iPad
* Intercepted weightception: stopped writing weight entries read from Apple Health back to Apple Health
* Fixed Apple Watch calorie ring animations
* Fixed color of the today extension text + “Save to my foods” + other web view sync issues

Enjoy your week, Lose It! fam. Happy tracking!

S..S..Spring? Is that you? In celebration of all things warm and wonderful, here's a fresh list of updates.

** Updated! We fixed a bug where the "Day Complete" checkmark wasn't updating when you navigated to previous or future dates
* Solved the decimal dilemma. Now, you can save decimal digits if you use the comma as a separator
* Made sure the log view is updated after logging an exercise routine on the iPad
* Fixed the food serving picker layout on the iPad
* Intercepted weightception: stopped writing weight entries read from the Apple Health app back to the Apple Health
* Fixed Apple Watch calorie ring animations
* Fixed color of the today extension text + “Save to my foods” + other web view sync issues

Enjoy your week, Lose It! fam. Happy tracking!
May we just say, we've spruced up this version with updates and fixes. Happy tracking!

We've retired our fancy hats from the derby and went back to work on a few updates.

* New and improved reminders screen
* Fixed a crash when trying to quick add calories from the watch app
* Made sure the log refreshes to show the new logged food when creating a food on the iPad

Start this week great right from the gate. Happy tracking!
No big updates, just pondering. What if soy milk is just milk introducing itself in Spanish?
Just updates and fixes, nothin' flashy. Keep being awesome out there.

Want to hear a pizza joke? Nevermind, it's too cheesy.
Here's an update to better the app, per the usual. Happy tracking!
Just a lil' thing: we've fixed a bug with the reminder spinner so it doesn't unexpectedly save a random hour. Much better. Keep being awesome out there!

A nice new release to help you track your pancakes.... or burgers?

* New and improved activity feed
* Updated y'all to a new Healthkit calorie bonus description on the log, making sure it shows correct past data (tap on your bonus to see it)
* Fixed layout of the sleep goal spinner to always be on the bottom; fixed the layout for the iPhone X
* Fixed weight lost in the weekly manual email report
* Fixed several issues with displaying negative net carbs

Stay flippin' awesome out there!

Hey everybody, come and see how good you look.

We upped the ante and made your member profile look sleeker and load faster. Check it out by tapping your name or a friend's name under the Social Tab. (If your profile needs some love, tap the Me tab and hit the pencil icon to update it.)

Now strut yo stuff. Happy tracking!

Hey everybody, come and see how good you look.
We upped the ante and made your member profile look sleeker and load faster. Check it out by tapping your name or a friend's name under the Social Tab. (If your profile needs some love, tap the Me tab and hit the pencil icon to update it.)

Now strut yo stuff. Happy tracking!

We didn't get invited to the surprise celebrity marriage, so we had time to make some updates:

* Changed the bottom of the serving size screen to show helpful options, like if you want to delete the food or switch up the meal.
* Formatted the date on the activity feed so you know when your last update happened right down to the minute.

Now get out there and get that Cardi-O. Happy tracking!

Quick fitness tip! Name your dog 5 Miles, then you can say "I walk 5 Miles every day." In this release:

* Fixed layout issues in the create food view
* Prepared a new motivating screen for when you mark your day complete (rolling out slowly, so you might not see it right away)
* Made other tweaks and improvements

Guess you could say we smoothed out some ruff edges. Happy tracking!

Suns out, puns out. All aboard, friends! We're shipping out an update with some fresh additions:

* We're serving up a game-changer on your log screen: you'll be able to pull down at the top of your daily log and see your weekly progress (slowly rolling this out to all members)
* Improved the friend and group lists so they're native to your app (aka better and faster)
* Fixed the issue causing the fat macronutrient header on the log to disappear

Shell, yeah. Hope you love it!

We'd like to take you on a date. Any date you'd like.

Here's how: on your log, tap the calendar icon by today's date to view a fullscreen calendar. It's an easy way to view days you've been under or over budget, or see where you might have a gap in a logging streak.

So, pick you up at 8? Happy tracking!

We'd like to take you on a date. Any date you'd like.

Here's how: on your log, tap the calendar icon by today's date to view a fullscreen calendar. It's an easy way to view days you've been under or over budget, or see where you might have a gap in a logging streak.

So, pick you up at 8? Happy tracking!
*Hikes up suspenders* Did we do that? We're sending out a fix for the crash happening when trying to set up an account from certain screens. Have a great day!
Why did the cookie go to the hospital? He was feeling crummy. (Delivering some fixes, fresh outta the oven!)
iPad folks, this one goes out for you. We fixed the bug causing the log to be the wrong width. Our iBad. Thanks for your reports so we could patch it up!

Success! We believe we’ve fixed the bug causing the app to fail on iPad. Shoutout to our beta testers who helped us get it done.. you da real MVP’s. (Still actively investigating some iPhone crashes - we’re on it!)

Success! We believe we’ve fixed the bug causing the app to fail on iPad. Shoutout to our beta testers who helped us get it done.. you da real MVP’s. (Still actively investigating some iPhone crashes - we’re on it!)
We fixed the bug where tapping on meal headers only took you to breakfast. Lunch and dinner were feeling left out. Happy tracking!
We've got some thyme on our hands for a little update. Orega-no big announcements, just general improvements.

I'll be there for you... this release is all about friends. Here's what we patched up:

* Fixed the issue preventing people from posting to a friend's wall
* Fixed the crash when opening the app from a conversation notification
* Other updates and improvements

Guess we were on a break? Glad that's cleared up.
Bug fixes
Those 3 little words we all want to hear: just general improvements.

Get ready to run - you can now connect your Garmin device through the Health app! Visit Me > More > Apps and Devices to sync up. We've also worked out the iPad bug preventing people from starting a new plan. Yep, we put some muscle behind this release.

Announcing our latest celeb partnership: Siri! Once Siri determines the timing of your meals and the food you typically log, it will suggest them to you for easier tracking. Gotta love having famous friends.

Announcing our latest celeb partnership: Siri! Once Siri determines the timing of your meals and the food you typically log, it will suggest them to you for easier tracking. Gotta love having famous friends.
We fixed the bug where logging from a Siri voice shortcut was failing. Couple of cough drops did the trick.

Boy were we in a jam! Butter get this update with the fixes:
* Fixed delete on My Foods, Custom Foods, and Recipes
* Fixed a bug preventing you from from logging in using Facebook

Glad we could roll this out for you. Happy tracking!

Get ready for the coolest thing to hit your wrist since 80's slap bracelets: we're adding support for Watch Series 4 complications! Check out the sweet gauges.

In other news, we fixed the bug causing the wrong log screen header to be displayed. Now it matches up with your log display, just like it should.

You're invited to the Cat Pajama Jam! Nevermind... these are just our release notes. We fixed the issue that stopped you from recording your weight if you were in a locale that uses a comma as the decimal separator. Now it should be working purrfectly.

Our taste in cheese, beer, and bread is about to get a whole lot better. Say hallo to our German version of Lose It! Wilkommen, friends!

But wait, there's more! If you love our barcode scanner, get this: We're launching a new nutrition label scanner to help you pull in a food's nutrient info in a flash. When creating a new food, tap the "autofill with your camera" button to launch the new scanner, and Lose It! will read the label for you. SO much easier than typing.

It's automagical. Happy tracking!
Oops, looks like something wasn't quite adding up with our plus button on the iPad - we got it now, coming at ya with the fix!
Oops, looks like something wasn't quite adding up with our plus button on the iPad - we got it now, coming at ya with the fix!

Shipping a fun, modernized look and feel for folks tracking nutrients! When you plan meals ahead (Premium), we'll now show your planned macros in the macronutrient header on the log and the nutrient chart on the My Day tab. Plus, we're sending a fix that prevents a potential crash, ‘cause we’re good like that.

Even wrote you a rap about it, in the popular "mumble" style:

bbdah, dah, no crash
mm-mm-macro tab
bddah dah plan that
mmm bddah, dah, track
No big news. Sending lots of cute lil tweaks to make Lose It! run fast... as fast as a toddler who just grabbed something she's not supposed to have.

Over here gettin' hygge with it. We've got our tea, blankets, and a nice release note for you: We fixed Airdrop meal sharing. So go ahead and share your meals with your roommates from the comfort of your sofa. Happy tracking!

We fixed the barcode cancel button, an Apple Health crash, and an issue with the iPad past dates, plus updated the app to let you set Saturday reminders (Premium). Which had us feeling pretty Grande:

Thought we'd fix up our barcode
so cancel button's a match
Wrote some code to fix our apple health integration
now the feature won't crash

Even patched up our iPad
Got it showing your past dates
Fixed the part with reminders
So you can choose Saturday

One fix was bugs
One fix was date-based
And one fix was barcode
Now, you're so amazing

We've logged and we've lost
but that's not what you see
Sure, look what we've got
Lose It! runs smoothly.

What do tortas, baguettes, and bibimbap have in common? Our app! Now introducing Lose It! in French, Spanish, Korean, Portuguese, and Simplified Chinese.

There's more! You'll see a new view when you set or edit your weight loss plan. (Visit goals > weight > tap weight > edit to check it out.) Plus, we've restored support for Apple Watch OS 4 (no more crashing).

We are so excited to welcome all our new friends: Bienvenue, bienvenido, 환영, bem vinda, and 欢迎. Stay awesome, and happy tracking!
Since we're busy searching last minute costumes, we'll keep it short: We added support for XS max and XR resolutions in the app! Your views should look absolutely boo-tiful.

What do tortas, baguettes, and bibimbap have in common? Our app! Now introducing Lose It! in French, Spanish, Korean, Portuguese, and Simplified Chinese.

There's more! You'll see a new view when you set or edit your weight loss plan. (Visit goals > weight > tap weight > edit to check it out.) Plus, we've restored support for Apple Watch OS 4 (no more crashing).

We are so excited to welcome all our new friends: Bienvenue, bienvenido, 환영, bem vinda, and 欢迎. Stay awesome, and happy tracking!

We also restored support for Apple Watch OS 4 (so no more crashing). Stay awesome, and happy tracking!

What do tortas, baguettes, and bibimbap have in common? Our app! Now introducing Lose It! in French, Spanish, Korean, Portuguese, and Simplified Chinese.

There's more! You'll see a new view when you set or edit your weight loss plan. (Visit goals > weight > tap weight > edit to check it out.) Plus, we've restored support for Apple Watch OS 4 (no more crashing).

We are so excited to welcome all our new friends: Bienvenue, bienvenido, 환영, bem vinda, and 欢迎. Stay awesome, and happy tracking!
A few updates, plus a gift to share at your holiday table: How do potatoes resolve an argument? ... They hash it out.  (Happy Thanksgiving!)

Step 1 to getting on Santa's good list: kick off December with some fixes!

* Fixed a bug where adding brand/supermarket foods to a recipe was failing
* Corrected to show scale-related custom goals if you have a Lose It! scale connected
* Other under-the-sleigh-hood improvements

Happy tracking, Lose It! fam.

Step 1 to getting on Santa's good list: kick off December with some fixes!

* Fixed a bug where adding brand/supermarket foods to a recipe was failing
* Corrected to show scale-related custom goals if you have a Lose It! scale connected
* Other under-the-sleigh-hood improvements

Happy tracking, Lose It! fam.

We interrupt your regularly scheduled romantic holiday flick and baking session to let you know we've updated Lose It! to make it suuuper smooth for the holidays. We're talkin' handsome-prince-you'd-fall-for-after-two-days-and-move-to-Aldovia smooth.

You can resume baking now. Happy tracking!

We interrupt your regularly scheduled romantic holiday flick and baking session to let you know we've updated Lose It! to make it suuuper smooth for the holidays. We're talkin' handsome-prince-you'd-fall-for-after-two-days-and-move-to-Aldovia smooth.
You can resume baking now. Happy tracking!

It's past mid-January and you're still here using a health and fitness app. And actually reading the release notes. Props.

This update is stacked...

Fresher than the produce section in your fridge after you make your resolutions.
More packed than the treadmills at the gym during the first week of the year.
Faster than the time it takes to whip up a smoothie you'll drink once and never again...

Except it's all behind-the-scenes. So you'll have to take our word for it. Happy tracking!
This release note is so chill, it's like Boston in January. Shipping out some behind-the-scenes improvements for ya, including a fix that loads previous meals properly. Enjoy.

Over here gettin' hygge with it. We've got our tea, blankets, and a nice release note for you: We fixed Airdrop meal sharing. So go ahead and share your meals with your roommates from the comfort of your sofa. Happy tracking!

This update will display your nutrient pie chart with calories from fat, carbs and protein.  No more unknown nutrients-- thanks for helping us realizing it could be a confusing experience! We'll also revert this change across your past days and weeks to truly make it right.

We fixed the barcode cancel button, an Apple Health crash, and an issue with the iPad past dates, plus updated the app to let you set Saturday reminders (Premium). Which had us feeling pretty Grande:

Thought we'd fix up our barcode
so cancel button's a match
Wrote some code to fix our apple health integration
now the feature won't crash

Even patched up our iPad
Got it showing your past dates
Fixed the part with reminders
So you can choose Saturday

One fix was bugs
One fix was date-based
And one fix was barcode
Now, you're so amazing

We've logged and we've lost
but that's not what you see
Sure, look what we've got
Lose It! runs smoothly.

Ahh, the elusive "general bug fixes and updates to keep your app running smoothly" note. We did fix bugs, make the app better, and do our thang. But there's really nothing we could say to make this note interesting for you.

SIKE. DJ, we're stepping up to the Post:

eh eh eh eh. ooh ooh ooh ooh.
eh eh.
ooh ooh ooh ooh.

Needless to say, we keep it in check
things can go bad-bad, nevertheless
when the app quits, don't be a wreck
No crashin at our app, cause we double-check

Needless to say, we keep it in check
things can go bad-bad, nevertheless
when the app quits, don't be a wreck
No crashin at our app, cause we double-check

Trackin in a good way, losin' your weight
Screamin' at the mirror, so excited
Some apps took a big L, don't know how that felt
Look at yourself, party with you
ooh, some things just don't need release
cause they'd be boring
and we all tryna lose

won't leave you left in the dust
Oh yeah we'll stick by ya
You're the best members
you'll never be too much
won't leave you left in the dust
Oh yeah we'll stick by ya
You're the best members
You're the best members

We've been pretty busy over here doing three things:
1. Fixed how we filter Previous Meals. It's an awesome feature you can enable under the Me tab > Application Preferences
2. Made helpful fixes here and there to keep things real nice
3. Got the Shallows song in our head. Then out of our head. Then back in again, except with "marshmallows"

Marsh-ma-ha, ha-ha-llows
Marshma-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-llows... we ate the marsh-ma-llows now.

Track on, rockstars.

1. Fixed how we filter Previous Meals. It's an awesome feature you can enable under the Me tab > Application Preferences
2. Made helpful fixes here and there to keep things real nice
3. Got the Shallows song in our head. Then out of our head. Then back in again, except with "marshmallows"
Marsh-ma-ha, ha-ha-llows
Marshma-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-llows... we ate the marsh-ma-llows now.

Track on, rockstars.
No big news. Sending lots of cute lil tweaks to make Lose It! run fast... as fast as a toddler who just grabbed something she's not supposed to have.

Have you ever dreamed of putting your top Premium goals right on your log? Well, pinch us... now you can choose to see Sleep, Blood, Pressure, Blood Glucose, Body Fat, and Measurement goals right with your tracking for the day.
Dream’s not over just yet. We fixed a few things: the display of Fitbit calorie bonuses on My Day on previous days, a crash when deleting a recipe ingredient (iOS 10) and the My Day recommendations for Premium members. So just a question...

Is this real?

Before you tweet, don’t move
’Cause we don’t wanna wake up
Wake up, wake up, wa-wake up
Don’t wanna wake up, oh no
Wake up, wake up, wa-wake up
’Cause it’s such a dream
If you can believe
It’s such a dream release. Mmmmm.

Shipping a fun, modernized look and feel for folks tracking nutrients! When you plan meals ahead (Premium), we'll now show your planned macros in the macronutrient header on the log and the nutrient chart on the My Day tab. Plus, we're sending a fix that prevents a potential crash, ‘cause we’re good like that.

Even wrote you a rap about it, in the popular "mumble" style:

bbdah, dah, no crash
mm-mm-macro tab
bddah dah plan that
mmm bddah, dah, track

This is it. The time of year when you find out how your friends and colleagues bite into a chocolate bunny (we're all ears). Let's hop to it:

* Fixed the macro percents rounding discrepancy between My Day and the log header
* Fixed spelling of "Burritos" in the Patterns feature (nobody wants "toes" in "burritos")
* Improved the Patterns experience for English speakers
* Started displaying converted kilojoules for individual meals in the meals tab

Shoutout to all our peeps! Happy tracking.

What up, world? We don't have a surprisingly impressive animated music video or inappropriate jokes to go along with this release note, but we do love the earth. Here's your update:

* Fixed a crash in the Patterns feature
* Fixed bug where passcode lock would prevent app from closing (lol ironic)
* Fixed bug where meal summaries showed the wrong nutrient totals
* Added voiceover compatibility to primary app features

We love this app, it is our favorite
We love this app, it is our own...

Happy tracking!

Andrea [5:56 AM]
No GOT spoilers here - you have your company chat and social media for that. Just good ol’ app info:

* Added Saturated Fat to Premium custom goals (both gram and percent-based goals)
* Fixed a bug where recommendations would show on My Day even when disabled
* Updated voiceover (including exercise, meal-specific plus button, mark day complete, and edit mode)
* Fixed a crash in the Patterns calendar and some other stray bugs
* Released Premium Insights to all our friends across the world
* Fixed an issue when navigating to the serving screen from recipes

This update totally slays. Happy tracking!
Fixed bugs, added improvements, and tried to judge speed of horses based on how cool their names were. We're feeling pretty accomplished.

Yeahhhh we're gonna take our app to the release mode
Gonna track 'til we can't no more
Gonna take our app to the release mode
Gonna track 'til we can't no more

We got the updates right on track
Info is attached
Listed here in black

* Prevented snapshot from showing when you launch app with passcode lock
* Fixed an issue where custom goals would show stale values
* Added search to Recipes and Custom Foods (under the Me tab)
* Made it so Premium members can view Patterns on the log screen

* tips cowboy hat to you *

Introducing a special guest to read you this week's update. See if you can guess who it is.

* We added some flair to the Weekly/Monthly calendar views on your log. Wow!
* Woooow. We improved the look of Challenges on the My Day tab.
* Also fixed a couple crashes in food search. WOOOWWWW.

If you heard Owen Wilson in your head, you're as weird as our release notes writer. Congrats?

Introducing a special guest to read you this week's update. See if you can guess who it is.
* We added some flair to the Weekly/Monthly calendar views on your log. Wow!
* Woooow. We improved the look of Challenges on the My Day tab.
* Also fixed a couple crashes in food search. WOOOWWWW.

If you heard Owen Wilson in your head, you're as weird as our release notes writer. Congrats?

We did mostly behind-the-scenes work, plus updated the Premium screen to include all your subscription details. But now this note feels so empty. So we leave you with this:

What do you call a chicken with the best dance moves? ... A Party Fowl.

Know why celery are terrible at relationships? | They're total stalkers.
Cool, now that's out of the way... our update! Along with typical bug fixes/improvements, we now send recipe ingredients as separate food items to Apple Health App.
Happy tracking!

Hakuna frittata, what a wonderful phrase. Hakuna frittata... here's your update!

* When you come back to your log, we make sure your header resets to calories, not a locked nutrient header. (Applicable to free/basic members)
* Removed supermarkets and restaurant sections from search results
* Made a clearer Premium subscription page, and added notifications on the Me tab for any subscription issues
* Added the option to exclude exercise calories from total (so you can track activity without adding calories back)

Song still in your head? Us too.

No need for new glasses - you might have noticed that when using the barcode scanner on your iPad the camera was off, but we fixed it (along with other improvements). Hindsight’s 20/20. Happy tracking!
It’s a brew-tiful day for some app updates. You’re gonna like these improvements a latte!
Suns out, guns out! We’re keeping the app looking good with a few minor bug fixes this week. Until next time!
We made a few minor updates to keep your app running smoother than a fresh jar of Skippy. Until next time!
Bugs aren’t fun, so we got rid of them in this update. Meal Plans and Exercise Guides are back in action! Happy tracking!

In this weeks release we did some tidying up. A few behind the scenes fixes, updates to our meal and goal icons, and squashed a bug where the log frequency for the blood glucose goal would change when entered! Thanks for using Lose It! Happy tracking!
It’s hot out there, so we wanted to freshen up a bit. Just a few general updates and bug fixes to keep your app fresh as a daisy!
This week we dolled up the app a bit and made a few small updates you probably won’t notice. Until next time, happy tracking!
This week we dolled up the app a bit and made a few small updates you probably won’t notice. Until next time, happy tracking!
Those 3 little words we all want to hear: just general improvements.
In this week’s update we polished up the app with a few fixes behind the scenes. Happy tracking!
The latest version contains behind the scenes bug fixes and performance improvements.  Happy tracking!
The latest version contains behind the scenes bug fixes and performance improvements. Happy tracking!

Now edit any food in our database: the icon, name, serving, or nutritional information! To edit a food, tap on it and scroll down to “edit nutritional information” (Edits you make are custom to you, and you won’t see edits that other people make). Go ahead; add heart emojis to the name of your favorite midday snack.
We also made editing recipes easier to find. When you’re logging your favorite recipes, scroll down and tap “Edit Recipe” to update it.
Happy Customizing!

Fall back into your routine with these latest changes to Lose It!:
- The Plus Button moved to the bottom so it’s easier to track the things you eat most
- The items in the ‘Me Tab’ and Challenges were moved to your Profile [top right corner]
- We’ve completely reworked how food search works so it’s nearly instant
- We fixed a bug where the app crashed when you edited a scanned barcode
We did all that and enjoyed our first PSL of the season! Happy tracking!

Fall back into your routine with these latest changes to Lose It!:
- The Plus Button moved to the bottom so it’s easier to track the things you eat most
- The items in the ‘Me Tab’ and Challenges were moved to your Profile [top right corner]
- We’ve completely reworked how food search works so it’s nearly instant
- We fixed a bug where the app crashed when you edited a scanned barcode
We did all that and enjoyed our first PSL of the season! Happy tracking!

The kids are back to school and we’re hard at work updating the app.
Here’s the latest:
- Garmin users can now see their Calorie Bonus on the My Day and Goals tabs.
- Fixed the barcode scanner bug that was freezing for some of you.
Happy snackin’ and trackin’!
We modernized the look of the food and exercise search screens to make them match the rest of the app. Enjoy!

We’re gearing up for the spookiest month of the year with some updates:

- Lose It! will now follow your system settings for Dark Mode (Premium members check out the fun themes!)
- iPad users can now use our like-magic auto-fill feature to add nutrition info from food labels
- And the AirDrop bug for iOS 13 users has been fixed!

Thanks for joining the dark side, enjoy the updates!
Using all of the time we saved not typing in passwords (thank you Sign in With Apple!) to fix some bugs. Happy Tracking!
Fall is here! We're busy carving pumpkins, leaf-peeping, and cleaning up the app with general bug fixes. Happy tracking!

This week we focused on updates to fix potential crashes and stability issues. And in case you missed us last week: we now support your system settings for Dark Mode. Thank you for being part of the Lose It! family!

We’re snazzing things up around here. We made some updates to the serving size page to bring the most important information about the food you’re logging front-and-center. We cleaned up a few other things while we were at it, too!
Feeling like real ghostbusters after fixing some spooky bugs this week. Happy Haunting!

This week we’re releasing an update to the popularity ranks for all the foods in our food database; they’ll now better reflect the trends in your latest food searches. We’ve got you covered, Impossible™ Burger fans!
Brrr, it’s cold out there! We hope you’re sitting by the fire and enjoying some of the bug fixes and behind-the-scenes improvements we made to the app. Happy tracking.
Your body counts every minute in that 36 minute elliptical session, and finally Lose It! does too. Our exercise duration picker is now in 1 minute increments.
We made some behind-the scenes improvements this week to make the app more welcoming to all of our new users. Welcome to the Lose It! fam!
We fixed some bugs to improve Siri Shortcuts and Siri Suggestions. Now there’s nothing in the way of you logging your breakfast with ‘Hey Siri’ or a tap straight from the home screen.
We made sure our last release for the year fixed a few last minute bugs and we are ready to support you heading into 2020.  See you in the New Year, Lose It! Fam!

We’re excited to announce a new, limited-time badge to give you extra motivation this month! If you track weight loss in the month of January, you’ll earn the exclusive Pennies for Pounds badge. Plus, for every pound our community loses, we’ll donate one cent to No Kid Hungry, up to $25,000!

We’re excited to announce a new, limited-time badge to give you extra motivation this month! If you track weight loss in the month of January, you’ll earn the exclusive Pennies for Pounds badge. Plus, for every pound our community loses, we’ll donate one cent to No Kid Hungry, up to $25,000!

Want to make sure the food you're searching for has the most accurate nutrition information? Just toggle on the "verified only" filter in your search results. It's now easier than ever to find the foods you need as you keep working hard this January!
Hey there, friends! Just a few quick updates from us this week: We've made it easier to search for groups, fixed the issue causing iPad crashes, and squashed some pesky bugs. Track ya later!
We’re shoring up our defense for the big game next weekend by making some behind the scenes improvements and fixes. Happy Snacking and Tracking!

We made some improvements to our Patterns feature so you can continue to identify the foods that help you reach your goals. We also squashed a few bugs, just to keep things neat and tidy. Snack ya later!

A few big updates coming at you in this release:
- For all you at-home cooks; you can now see the full nutrition information per serving of recipes you create in Lose It!. No need to create a new one- we’ll show you the nutrient breakdown on old recipes too!
- You can now adjust your personal activity level to give you more control over your daily calorie budget; just head to Goals > tap on the weight chart > tap 'Edit'

This week we finished rolling out improvements to food search and spent some time fixing an issue with the barcode scanner to work better with UPC-A barcodes. We also made it so you will now see today’s meals in “Recent Meals” when logging for a future date. Enjoy!
Have questions around how to edit your plan? We’ve added a help button in the Edit Plan screen to more easily support you in adjusting your weight loss plan.

We’ve added a couple new features this release, let us know what you think by emailing us at newfeature@loseit.com
- We added the ability to set a fixed calorie budget that won’t change. Thanks to all of our members who requested this feature!
- You can now hide meal targets on the Log Screen via Meal Settings. To hide, go to Profile > Meal Settings.

We might have lost an hour of sleep, but we've been super productive over here at Lose It! HQ. Here are some updates we've made:
- We've added the option to reset your plan. To reset go to Goals > tap on your Weight Chart > Edit.
- We fixed a bug that occurred when you'd search for verified-only foods.

We redesigned and simplified our camera by combining the barcode scanner and food image recognition into one view! Now just point the camera at either a barcode or piece of food and we’ll recognize what it is. We also added a button to the log screen so you can more quickly add previous meals. Enjoy!

We’ve got a couple of updates for you this week:
- You can now hide the add-previous-breakfast option that appears on the log.
- Now you can select the date you want to log airdropped meals.
- We fixed a patterns crash.
Over and out!
Earning steps bonuses is still free! We cleaned up an issue on My Day that was suggesting otherwise. Happy Tracking.
We’re keeping the app running smooth so you can keep on with your daily routine — happy tracking!
We made lots of behind-the-scenes fixes and improvements this week to keep the app running smoothly.
We did some work this week to modernize and clean up the photo-taking feature. Can you say ‘cheese’!?

Timestamps are here! We’re super excited to be unveiling this long-requested feature to all of our users! To add a timestamp to a food, scroll down on the page where you select the serving size and tap “add a timestamp”.


Once you’ve added some timestamps, you can view your food log as a timeline. Snack ya later!

Let us know what you think about timestamps. Send feedback to newfeature@loseit.com
We made a few behind the scenes fixes this week to keep things running smoothly.

We made a bunch of updates to the app. Here's the new stuff coming at ya this week:
- We added newer workouts from Apple Health including Barre, Flexibility, High-Intensity Interval Training, and Wheelchair Run & Walk.
- Fixed the bug where timestamps in the app and Apple Health didn't add up for users in +GMT timezones.
- Fixed an issue when sending a meal via Airdrop.
- Fixed a crash happening on the insights page.
- If you don't log any meals but you exercise, we'll show the net calories on My Day rather than the "Nothing logged so far today" message.
Just some general housekeeping and bug fixed this week to keep things neat and tidy. Until next time!
Just some general housekeeping and bug fixed this week to keep things neat and tidy. Until next time!
Just some general housekeeping and bug fixed this week to keep things neat and tidy. Until next time!

Add your fav foods to Lose It! even more easily by scanning nutrition labels with Smart Camera! Simply tap "+" on the log, then click "Scan a food item". Position the camera over the nutrition label and wait for the values to populate. Select 'Create Food', add a name and hit save - as simple as that!
This week’s update includes some bug fixes and performance improvements to keep Lose It! running smoothly. Until next time!
We made a few general updates and bug fixes to get the app summer-ready! Snack ya later.
This week, we squashed some bugs and fixed an issue where the goal thermometer was showing the wrong color. Now we’re ready to soak up some sunshine!
Just the usual this week: fixing bugs and watching our members be amazing! Ta ta for now!

- We've updated the recipe feature so you can now copy a recipe and add additional serving units. In addition, we've made it easier to create and edit recipes in general.
- We've updated the Apple Watch and Steps connection and status screens to be easier to understand. Go to your profile and look under Apps & Devices to see the new settings.
- We fixed an issue some users ran into where nutrients weren't displaying correctly.
- We also made sure existing measurement goal values continue to display in the unit type you selected.
Bug fixes and performance improvements to keep the app running in tip-top shape. Happy logging, Lose It! fam!

Things are busy over here at Lose It! HQ. Here’s what we’ve been up to:
- Fixed a conversion bug when editing a recipe’s portion size
- Updated our Apple Health connection screens to make the connection status more clear
Over and out!

Things are busy over here at Lose It! HQ. Here’s what we’ve been up to:
- Fixed a conversion bug when editing a recipe’s portion size
- Updated our Apple Health connection screens to make the connection status more clear
Over and out!
Not a ton to update on this week, folks. Just squashing some bugs and making general improvements to keep things running smoothly for ya!

This week we soaked up the summer sun and made a few general updates to keep things running smoothly. Stay cool!
Not a ton to update on this week, folks. Just squashing some bugs and making general improvements to keep things running smoothly for ya!

Hey all, we’ve got a couple of updates for ya this week:
- Now, when you pull down on the log header, the weekly view will be filled in correctly for calories or kilojoules
- If you’ve got pending food items, we’ll no longer show you the ‘Previous Breakfast’ shortcut.
Over and out!
Not a ton to update on this week, folks. Just squashing some bugs and making general improvements to keep things running smoothly for ya!

Check out the new Groups page under the Social Tab, to see a feed of popular group posts from Lose It! community members. Use the dropdown to scroll through a feed of posts from groups you’ve joined.


We've also updated our theme select page to give you a better preview of what a theme will look like with the current version of the app.
Happy tracking!

Check out the new Groups page under the Social Tab, to see a feed of popular group posts from Lose It! community members. Use the dropdown to scroll through a feed of posts from groups you’ve joined.

We've also updated our theme select page to give you a better preview of what a theme will look like with the current version of the app.
Happy tracking!
Not a ton to update on this week, folks. Just squashing some bugs and making general improvements to keep things running smoothly for ya!
Hey there, friends. We made some updates, and now you can restore previous weight history if you started a new weight loss plan. Snack ya on the flip side!

We’ve launched two widgets for iOS 14 users so you can view macros and calories directly from the home screen.
- Go to your home screen and enter edit mode.
- Tap the plus button in the upper left-hand corner and add the Lose It! widget.
If you have any comments or feedback, we would love to hear from you. Drop us a line at newfeature@loseit.com

We’ve launched two widgets for iOS 14 users so you can view macros and calories directly from the home screen.
- Go to your home screen and enter edit mode.
- Tap the plus button in the upper left-hand corner and add the Lose It! widget.
If you have any comments or feedback, we would love to hear from you. Drop us a line at newfeature@loseit.com

A few updates for you this week!
- We've updated widgets to display kilojoules
- We've added another widget to view daily calories as a ring
- We've also allowed timestamped meals to give the time stamp to all foods added via the quick add feature.

- We've updated the widgets to update more consistently.
- We fixed an issue where the Challenges links weren't working correctly.

We've got a couple of fixes for you this week. Happy Tracking!
- We fixed how reps are calculated for included workouts.
- We fixed a widget bug for our users on the other side of the Meridian.

We've got a couple of fixes for you this week. Happy Tracking!
- We fixed how reps are calculated for included workouts.
- We fixed a widget bug for our users on the other side of the Meridian.

New features:
– Support iPad rotation for plan card recommendations
– Enable full screen calendar for iPad
– Use Kilojoules in Widget according to LoseIt unit preferences
– Macro configuration for Ring Widget
– Visual tweaks to Meal Summary and launch it from log cards

Bug Fixes:
– Fix duplicate shared recipe ingredients
– Fix peeking of weekly header behind log header on iPad
– Fix collapsed log header full width thermometer

We spent some time this week fixing some issues and bugs. Thanks for sending us your feedback!
- Fixed an issue on the iPad where the orange title bar wasn't rotating correctly after switching between portrait and landscape
- Fixed a bug where the weight calculations seemed like they were different between the goals tab and the goals details page
- Fixed a bug where historic exercise reps would change to match calories burned at the new weight

- Fixed a recipe sharing issue where notes weren't attached when sending
- Fixed some minor UI bugs
- Fixed performance issues
- Fixed syncing issues

We’re grabbing an extra cup of coffee for a little caffeine boost so we can keep making great updates for ya. So far, we fixed a bug where weight entry and custom foods with a decimal place weren’t able to save. Until next time!

Here’s what we’ve been up to this week:
- Created a new set of diverse themes. Check them out in your profile.
- Added support for the new Apple Silicon Macs.
- Fixed issue where restore weight history didn’t sync.
- Tweaked a few issues with the sharing flow.

We’re busy prepping our turkey and making some app updates this week:
- Fixed layout issues on the Apple Watch
- Fixed an issue where were weren't converting to kilojoules
- Fixed a crash when tapping on a link in a recipe note
- Added the ability to have multiple links in the recipe notes
- Fixed an error when tapping on a recipe without any ingredients
- Fixed an issue with remembering the state of the most recently logged exercise

Here’s what we’ve been up to this week:
- Added translation support to our watch app
- Fixed an issue with text being cut off on the log screen
- Fixed some under-the-hood stability issues

Here’s what we’ve been up to this week:
- Added translation support to our watch app
- Fixed an issue with text being cut off on the log screen
- Fixed some under-the-hood stability issues

Logging food and losing weight is even easier with this update:
- We simplified the log screen to more clearly show how to add food to a meal
- We made design updates to the Watch App to mirror the Lose It! widget

We’re getting in the holiday spirit and making some tweaks to the app:
- Made some additional speed improvements to the Apple Watch app
- Fixed restoring weight history
- Updated themes to apply on all navigation bars

We’re getting in the holiday spirit and making some tweaks to the app:

We're starting 2021 with a new launcher widget on the Log screen and an updated, clearer Food Insights screen. Happy New Year from the Lose It! team!

We made some quick fixes to make sure things are running smoothly.

This week, we made some updates to how the Previous Meal Feature looks. Take it for a spin and make your log complete!

While its cold outside, we've been heating up the app with some quick fixes:
- We fixed an error when you tried to reset your password
- We increased the tappable size for the clock on future planned meals
- We fixed a bug and added the daily rings into the serving size page of a food

Now that Valentine's Day is over, we broke up with some small bugs: we fixed some theme background issues and tweaked the Goals bar charts to look a little better. We feel better already!

Hi there! This week we've made some changes to improve the app experience:
- We fixed an issue when you rotate the orientation on the iPad app
- And squashed a bug that was stopping Apple Health from syncing.
Happy Tracking!
